name: US State Populations (2020)
why: Populations span orders of magnitude and typically follow Benford's Law.

name: Major US River Lengths
summary: Lengths of major U.S. rivers in miles.
why: Natural measurements across wide scales often align with Benford's distribution.

name: Sample Stock Closing Prices
summary: Synthetic but realistic closing prices for a mixed-cap portfolio.
why: Market prices across many scales tend to approximate Benford behavior.

name: Earthquake Magnitudes (Synthetic)
summary: Synthetic earthquake magnitudes across many events.
why: Seismic magnitudes roughly follow a logarithmic distribution.

name: Lottery Numbers (Uniform)
summary: Uniform random lottery draws between 1 and 69.
why: Uniform random draws break Benford's skew toward low leading digits.

name: Dice Rolls (1-6)
summary: Outcomes from rolling a single six-sided die.
why: Single-digit uniform outcomes do not match Benford's distribution.

name: Human Heights (cm)
why: Narrow biological measurements center on 1xx and typically violate Benford.
